page.title: 17HOUSING
page.content: Many of the{houses}are part of the estate owned by{Lord Harlech.}They were built to accommodate estate workers employed at Brogyntyn, the seat of the Harlech family. Local building materials including stone for walls and slate for the roofs are commonly found. As such the dwellings blend into the countryside. Very few{modern}buildings occur, so bricks and tiles are rarely to be seen. Many cottages no longer used for agricultural workers have been bought by young couples for{restoration}and {modernisation.}Some have extended their dwellings. Most houses have large gardens and are spaced out. Central heating and modern appliances have frequently been added to the older cottages.
